page.title: 05S.W.GUILDFORD:FARMING
page.content: As Guildford, a large town, is nearby some of the land is devoted to market gardening. This involves growing strawberries, lettuces and tomatoes. These are grown in greenhouses or on sun-facing slopes, especially on the Hog's Back area and towards Shalford village and Godalming. Many cows, especially Friesians, are kept on grasslands to yield milk for the towns and villages and for butter and cheese production. Cereals are grown in the Vale of Holmsdale to the east of the town, in the Compton and Loseley area to the west and at the foot of the Hog's Back hills. The soils are fertile and the farming is good and prosperous. Some farmers in the area are quite rich. Kathryn Holden
